Package drawit

Class IntPoint

java.lang.Object
drawit.IntPoint
public class IntPoint
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    IntPoint​(int x, int y)
    Initializes this object with given x- and y- coordinates.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description

    Returns a DoublePoint object with the same variables as the given IntPoint object.

    Returns whether this IntPoint object's coordinates are equal to the given IntPoint object's coordinates

    Gives back the x-coordinate of the IntPoint object

    Gives back the y-coordinate of the IntPoint object

    Returns whether this IntPoint object lies on the line made by the two given IntPoint objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • IntPoint

      public IntPoint​(int x, int y)
      Initializes this object with given x- and y- coordinates.
      Postconditions:
      The object's x coordinate equals the given x 
      getX() == x
      The object's y coordinate equals the given y 
      getY() == y

  • Method Details

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Gives back the x-coordinate of the IntPoint object
      Returns:
      the x coordinate | getX() == x

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Gives back the y-coordinate of the IntPoint object
      Returns:
      the y coordinate | getY() == y

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(IntPoint other)
      Returns whether this IntPoint object's coordinates are equal to the given IntPoint object's coordinates
      Postconditions:
      returns true if this IntPoint is equal to the given IntPoint. 
      (getX() == other.x && getY() == other.y) == true || 
(getX() == other.x && getY() == other.y) == false

    • minus

      public IntVector minus​(IntPoint other)
      Returns the IntVector from the given IntPoint to this IntPoint
      Postconditions:
      The given IntPoint's coordinates are substracted from this IntPoint's coordinates. 
      result.getX() == this.getX() - other.getX() &&
result.getY() == this.getY() - other.getY()

    • isOnLineSegment

      public boolean isOnLineSegment​(IntPoint b, IntPoint c)
      Returns whether this IntPoint object lies on the line made by the two given IntPoint objects.
      Postconditions:
      returns true if this IntPoint object lies on the line made by the two given IntPoint objects. 
      result == (c.minus(b).isCollinearWith(this.minus(b)) == true && this.minus(b).dotProduct(c.minus(b)) > 0 && 
this.minus(b).dotProduct(c.minus(b)) < c.minus(b).dotProduct(c.minus(b)) ? true : false)

    • asDoublePoint

      public DoublePoint asDoublePoint()
      Returns a DoublePoint object with the same variables as the given IntPoint object.
      Postconditions:
      Returns a DoublePoint object with the same variables as the given IntPoint object. 
      result.getX() == this.getX() &&
result.getY() == this.getY()

    • plus

      public IntPoint plus​(IntVector vector)
      Returns an IntPoint whose coordinates are the addition of this IntPoint's coordinates and the given IntPoint's coordinates
      Postconditions:
      The point is displaced over the given vector. 
      result.getX() == this.getX() + vector.getX() &&
result.getY() == this.getY() + vector.getY()

    • lineSegmentsIntersect

      public static boolean lineSegmentsIntersect​(IntPoint a, IntPoint b, IntPoint c, IntPoint d)
      Checks whether the two IntVectors created by the four given IntPoints instersect
      Postconditions:
      returns true if the given IntVectors ab and cd have intersecting lines, otherwise returns false. 
      result == true || result == false
